    def test_validate_config_with_parent_attribute(self):
        """Test validate_config handles objects with parent attribute"""
        child = Mock()
        child.validate = Mock()
        child._properties = ["name"]
        child.get.side_effect = lambda x: "child1" if x == "name" else None
        child.__class__.__name__ = "Child"
        child.__module__ = "snappi.child"
    
        parent = Mock()
        parent.validate = Mock()
        parent._properties = ["name"]
        parent.get.side_effect = lambda x: "parent1" if x == "name" else None
        parent.__class__.__name__ = "Parent"
        parent.__module__ = "snappi.parent"
    
        # Child has parent attribute
        child.parent = parent
    
        config = Mock()
        config.validate = Mock()
        config._properties = ["children"]
        config.__class__.__name__ = "Config"
    
        children_iter = Mock()
        children_iter.__module__ = "snappi.children"
        children_iter.__iter__ = Mock(return_value=iter([child]))
    
        config.get.side_effect = lambda x: children_iter if x == "children" else None
    
        with patch("builtins.hasattr", side_effect=lambda obj, attr: attr in ["_properties", "__module__", "__next__", "parent"] if obj is child else attr in ["_properties", "__module__"]):
            with patch("builtins.dir", return_value=["__module__", "__next__"]):
                with patch("builtins.getattr", side_effect=lambda obj, attr, default=None: parent if obj is child and attr == "parent" else default):
                    self.api.snappi_config = config
